name: St. Germanus I of Constantinople

locations.description: Patriarch of Constantinople who opposed iconoclasm

summary: Germanus I was the Patriarch of Constantinople from 715 to 730. He was a staunch defender of the veneration of icons and opposed the iconoclastic policies of Emperor Leo III. When the emperor began to destroy icons, Germanus refused to comply and was forced to resign. He wrote several theological works defending the use of icons and is venerated as a saint in the Eastern Orthodox Church.
